intro: Vaccinium blepharocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the western United States and parts of Canada, typically found in moist, acidic soils of forests and mountainous regions. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, followed by edible berries that are dark blue to black in color. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand cold climates and acidic conditions. The plant plays an important ecological role, providing food for wildlife and supporting local biodiversity.
